TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit SubjectIdentifierOrKey extends System.Object

Docs.summary: The SubjectIdentifierOrKey class defines the type of the identifier of a subject, such as a or a . The subject can be identified by the certificate issuer and serial number, the hash of the subject key, or the subject key.
The Type property retrieves the type of subject identifier or key. The subject can be identified by the certificate issuer and serial number, the hash of the subject key, or the subject key.
Docs.value: A member of the enumeration that specifies the type of subject identifier.

Docs.summary: The Value property retrieves the value of the subject identifier or key. Use the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.SubjectIdentifierOrKey.Type%2A> property to determine the type of subject identifier or key, and use the Value property to retrieve the corresponding value.
Docs.value:
An <xref:System.Object> object that represents the value of the subject identifier or key. This <xref:System.Object> can be one of the following objects as determined by the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.SubjectIdentifierOrKey.Type%2A> property.
<xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.SubjectIdentifierOrKey.Type%2A> property
Object
IssuerAndSerialNumber
SubjectKeyIdentifier
<xref:System.String>
PublicKeyInfo
